result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael J. Trelka in court with attorney Leon Stanley Schmidt. Defendant Michael J. Trelka in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are: 13CF-330, 14CF-42, 15CF-10, 14CF-249, 14CF-123, 14CF-86, 14TR-123, 14TR-122, 14TR-121, 14TR-2456, 14TR-2457, 14TR-965, 14TR-966, 14TR-964 and 14TR-967.

8:35 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Atty Knaapen has provided the Court and Clerk an agreement of anticipation of a plea. State is recommending a prison so parties are not anticipating doing a sentencing today, anticipating a PSI. Atty Schmidt concurs.  

Atty Knaapen states plea agreement for the record. 
13CF-330 - Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 would be dismissed. Count 3 and Count 4 Defendant would plead to. Count 5 would be dismissed and read in. Defense free to argue.
14CF-42 - Defendant will plead to Count 1. This would be a third offense. Count 2 and 3 would be dismissed and read in. Defense free to argue.
14CF-86 - Would be dismissed and read in.
14CF-123 - Defendant will plead ot Count 1 and Count 3 and Count 4 (would be come a 4th offense). Counts 2 and 5 would be dismissed and read in. Defense free to argue.
14CF-249 - Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 would be dismissed. Defendant will plead to Count 3 and Count 4. Counts 5, 6, 7 and 8 would be dismissed and read in. Defense free to argue.
15CF-10 - State intends to dismiss and read in all 6 counts. An initial appearance needs to be held in this case.
All the TR files will be dismissed and read in.

Atty Schmidt concurs.
Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

15CF-10: Initial Appearance.
Atty Schmidt has received a copy of the complaint, waives reading.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.
Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.
Court questions Defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing.
Court questions Atty Schmidt.
Court binds Defendant over for trial.
Atty Schmidt enters pleas of NOT GUILTY to all counts.
Court accepts the pleas.

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalites.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
13CF-330: Count 1: GUILTY
13CF-330: Count 3: GUILTY
13CF-330: Count 4: GUILTY
14CF-042: Count 1: GUILTY - amended to 3rd offense
14CF-123: Count 1: GUILTY
14CF-123: Count 3: GUILTY
14CF-123: Count 4: GUILTY - amended to 4th offense
14CF-249: Count 1: GUILTY
14CF-249: Count 3: GUILTY
14CF-249: Count 4: GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Schmidt for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
13CF-330: Count 1 OWI 4th offense
13CF-330: Count 2 Dismissed
13CF-330: Count 3 Obstructing an Officer
13CF-330: Count 4 Operating After Revocation 2nd Offense
13CF-330: Count 5 Dismissed and Read In
14CF-42: Count 1 Operating After Revocation 3rd Offense
14CF-42: Count 2 Dismissed and Read In
14CF-42: Count 3 Dismissed and Read In
14CF-86: Dismissed and Read In
14CF-123: Count 1 Felony Bailjumping
14CF-123: Count 2 Dismissed and Read In
14CF-123: Count 3 Obstructing An Officer
14CF-123: Count 4 Operating After Revocation 4th Offense
14CF-123: Count 5 Dismissed and Read In
14CF-249: Count 1 OWI 5th offense
14CF-249: Count 2 Dismissed
14CF-249: Count 3 Obstructing an Officer
14CF-249: Count 4 Felony Bailjumping
14CF-249: Count 5 Dismissed and Read In
14CF-249: Count 6 Dismissed and Read In
14CF-249: Count 7 Dismissed and Read In
14CF-249: Count 8 Dismissed and Read In
15CF-10: Dismissed and Read In
14TR-121: Dismissed and Read In
14TR-122: Dismissed and Read In
14TR-123: Dismissed and Read In
14TR-964: Dismissed and Read In
14TR-965: Dismissed and Read In
14TR-966: Dismissed and Read In
14TR-967: Dismissed and Read In
14TR-2456: Dismissed and Read In
14TR-2457: Dismissed and Read In

Parties are requesting a PSI.

BY THE COURT:
Court will order a PSI.
Copies are to be provided to the parties at least a week before the sentencing hearing.

State requests the Court to revoke bonds.

BY THE COURT:
Court will revoke bonds.

Atty Schmidt addresses the Court, housekeeping matter.

9:20 AM Court is in recess.
This bond covers all files: 13CF-330, 14CF-42, 14CF-86, 14CF-123, 14CF-249, and 15CF-10. Comply with all conditions of bond in all cases.

Defendant Michael J. Trelka appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty David R. Knaapen appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are:
13CF-330, 14CF-42, 14CF-86, 14CF-123, 14CF-249 and 15CF-10.

1:03 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states apperances.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, 14CF-249 was set for a jury trial yesterday.  All the cases heard yesterday were ordered warrants and bonds forfeited.

Defendant has not been in compliance with pretrial supervision program recently.

State requests $25,000 cash bond, to cover all the files, in addition to any cash that was posted.

Court addresses the TR files. 

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, a plea hearing is set for July 16th at 8:30 am, which was established yesterday after Defendant was in custody.

Attorney Leon Stanley Schmidt in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All cases heard at this time are: 13CF-330, 14CF-42, 14CF-86, 14CF-123, 14CF-249, 15CF-10, 14TR-121, 14TR-122, 14TR-123, 14TR-964, 14TR-965, 14TR-966, 14TR-967, 14TR-2456 and 14TR-2457.

9:21 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Defendant does not appear but Defense does appear.

Atty Schmidt addresses the Court, does not know exactly where he is. Defendant made it to the courthouse this morning, but ended up being afraid to come into the courthouse and ended up driving away.  Defendant would not come out.  Atty Schmidt talked with his client on the phone after he left, could not get him to come in.  Defendant is just afraid to come into the courthouse, is having a hard time coming to grips with the situation, lost 50 pounds.  Defendant's family is trying to get his client here.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, State requests warrants.

14CF-249 was set for a jury trial today. Court did have a telephone conference with the attorneys yesterday out of the concern Defendant was not going to appear.  Court then set this matter for an appearance and cancelled the jury trial. 

BY THE COURT:
14CF-249: Court authorizes bench warrant for arrest. Any bonds posted are forfeited.
Court authorizes warrant on all criminal files, all bonds forfeited. 

Atty Schmidt states that the TR files can be handled with Atty Knaapen. 

Court will set all the TR files for a pretrial date. 

Atty Schmidt replies. 

All the TR cases will be set for a pretrial on October 12, 2015 at 8:30 AM Branch 1.

9:31 AM Court is in recess.
1:36 p.m. Attorney Leon S. Schmidt in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Defendant fails to appear.  State requests warrant.  BTC:  Criminal Warrant - body only
